findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract utilizes the variable `rebaseMultiple`. If this variable is altered by the `rebase` function, it will cause the contract to halt transactions for all users.

findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `rebase` function. As a result, the contract tokens will be highly inflated.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the price of the token can be highly volatile, potentially leading to significant price volatility for parties involved.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to decrease gas consumption and ensure the value cannot be changed after it has been set.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can decrease readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.
